Quality control -> External QC: QBase

Create the QBase organization in GLIMS

Click Start -> Correspondents -> Organizations -> By Mnemonic and insert a new organization. Fill out the following fields:

  • Mnemonic: QBase
  • Name: QBase

Create a QBase coding system for the QBase organization

Create a QBase coding system

First, one should create a coding system with a property code set for the QBase organization (created above).  Click Start -> Correspondents -> Organizations and zoom into the QBase correspondent.  In the 'Other' page, you can specify a coding system.

Create a new coding system with 

  • Mnemonic: QBase
  • Name: QBase
  • Usage: ? 

Create a property code set for the QBase coding system

From the QBase coding system, select the contextual menu function 'Code sets' and create a code set with 
  • Table: Property

From the Code set, select the contextual menu function 'Codes' and define the QBase codes related to the properties in GLIMS.

  • Record: select the property for which a QBase code must be defined
  • Value: enter the QBase code

Specify a cluster name for the QC populations to be exported

For each QC population to be exported in QBase format you have to specify a cluster name.  This cluster name has the following format for QBase version 3 and QBase version 4:

Cluster name format for QBase version 3 and 4

1. Enquete
2. Cluster nummer
3. Materiaal nummer
4. Materiaal type: E(xtern) / I(ntern)
5. Level nummer
6. Materiaal nummer: if the materiaal type is E(xtern), then you should also specify the extern materiaal nummer. (16 in the example below).

Example: Combi,1,2,E,3,16
